intro: Cleistanthus xerophilus, commonly known as the desert cleistanthus, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers and its ability to thrive in dry, sandy soils. The plant has a woody stem and produces small, oval-shaped fruits that contain a single seed. It is adapted to withstand extreme drought conditions, making it a resilient species in harsh environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of desert ecosystems.
